Insert Peripherally Inserted Central Catheter
Routine, Reason: Difficult IV Access, using ultrasound guidance and tip confirmation technology if available and clinically appropriate
Routine, Reason: Home IV Therapy, using ultrasound guidance and tip confirmation technology if available and clinically appropriate
Routine, Reason: Antibiotic Therapy, using ultrasound guidance and tip confirmation technology if available and clinically appropriate
Routine, Reason: TPN or Lipids, using ultrasound guidance and tip confirmation technology if available and clinically appropriate
Routine, Reason: Chemotherapy, using ultrasound guidance and tip confirmation technology if available and clinically appropriate

lidocaine 1% inj
2 mL, intradermal, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
lidocaine 2% inj
1 mL, intradermal, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
LORazepam PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 2 mg, sublingual, q5min, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when PICC line is inserted, then place XR Chest, to confirm tip PICC placement before use

as directed
